description:
Your own private suite with bathroom and partial kitchenette in artsy Lansdowne with utilities and on-site laundry included. Just a stone’s throw to Philly but in a quiet residential area. Please read CAREFULLY before contacting homeowner:
• All Utilities and Wifi included
• Furnished (Bed, kitchen table and modern upholstered chair are all less than 2 years old: They are not in the pictures...)
• Up to 2 cats allowed. Me-ow! =)
• Media-Elwyn train line (station 6 blocks away): 12 minute train ride to University City!
• Several Bus Lines go through 1 block away
• 3 blocks to Trolley Line @ Congress Ave stop (69th Street --- Media)
• Ample parking right out front with $40/year permit
• Running track and tennis courts 1 block away
• Laundry in basement included
• SMOKE FREE home (only inquiries from NON-smokers, NON-Vape please)
• Just 3-6 block walk to Downtown Lansdowne shopping: Camelia Coffee House, Vinyl Revival record store, Lansdowne Farmer’s Market, Jamey’s House of Music Jazz Club, Kia’s Cake and Coffee Shop, Dollar Store and more
• $830/month includes utilities
• Great fit for Students, Flight attendants or pilots (14 minutes from PHL airport!), people saving to buy a house, someone separated or just starting over… or someone having a hard time finding a place that allows cats.
• Available Jan 18 2023
This space is bigger than the pictures appear and very quiet. Homeowner is a quiet professional with cats. Home is kept neat and clean and is a No Drugs, No Loud Parties, No Drama zone.
One limitation: there is not an official kitchen in your private space. There’s a new Full sized fridge, Toaster Oven, Microwave, plug in burner, plug in griddle, some dishes and pots and pans (if needed: appliances can be moved if you have your own). It’s best for no-frills dining and not a good fit for those who like to bake or make elaborate meals.
Entrance involves walking through the homeowner’s space and up to your 3rd floor. No private entrance but your third floor is completely private.
Credit and Criminal background check required with application. Application fee $45.
One Year Agreement. Possible shorter 6 or 9 month agreement would be considered with a one time pre-payment for the professional cleaning fee of $150 to prepare for the next housemate.
First month, Last month and security deposit ($600) due to move in: $2260
ONLY if you have read ALL of this and it sounds like a good fit please email to set up a quick phone pre-screen chat and then a showing.
Please answer the following via EMAIL:
1) what date you're looking to move in
2) confirm that you are OK with background check
3) confirm that you're OK with phone interview before showing
4) confirm that you understand the kitchen situation
5) confirm that $2260 to move-in is something you can do
If your email doesn't at least include that info. it will not be answered. Before setting up phone interview I want to know that you have read this completely and are a person who is conscientious and pays attention to detail.
Thanks! Sara

description:
Thank you for your interest in The Glen at Shawmont Station Apartments.  Below is our current availability and pricing.  Below you will find information on each available unit as well as pre-recorded virtual tours.  If you’d like to apply to any of these units, you can do so at www.theglenphilly.com.  Information regarding amenities, utilities and pets are on the the website.
The Glen at Shawmont Station is proud to host various food trucks almost weekly on the property.  Today, January 15, 2023, we have our Algorithms Vegan Food Truck here from 12 p.m. - 6 p.m. come on out and grab some lunch with them and meet other residents who live here!
The application process is easy.
1.	Locate the apartment you want to rent on www.theglenphilly.com and hit “select”.
2.	Complete the application on all parts and submit with the $500.00 security deposit and $50.00 application fee.
3.	Send proof of income and photo ID to  show contact info
.
4.	If approved with good credit your deposit remains $500.00.  Approved conditionally the deposit is one month’s rent, the $500.00 initial deposit will go towards that and you would owe the balance at move in.  If denied, the deposit is refunded in check form.
5.	If you decide our community is not right for you after applying, you have 72 hours from applying to cancel in writing (email) to receive your refund of the $500.00.  The deposit is not refundable after 72 hours if you cancel your application.
6.	Your gross monthly income (this is income before taxes) must equal three times the monthly rent to be approved.  Incomes are combined.
7.	Twenty-four hours before move-in, you would pay your admin/city fees of $330.00, any pet fees if applicable and the first month’s rent.

description:

. *
Move into this RENOVATED & UPGRADED 3-story, 2-bedroom vintage 19th-century traditional "trinity" townhouse. This historic, uniquely Philadelphia-style home features refinished ORIGINAL hardwood floors and ceramic tiled kitchen & bathroom. There's central air conditioning throughout the house and your own washing machine & dryer in the basement. Plus a private patio & 2nd floor deck!
** Yes it's quirky... a vintage 1800s Philly "trinity" house, with a bohemian 1970s renovation. This means incredible original hardwood floors and handcrafted kitchen cabinets, among other distinguishing characteristics. The house is newly upgraded with central a/c, a stainless steel dishwasher, Ikea modular shelving system over the refrigerator and gas stove, and more! **
304 Sears Street
Queen Village Adjacent / Pennsport, Philadelphia
Monthly Rent: $1495
Utilities: Gas, Electric & Water on your own meters.
Lease: 1 year lease required, then month-to-month w/winter term.
Move-in: 1st & last month + security.
Pets: Cat or small dog considered with pet addendum and deposit.
Living Room: Solid wood door opens into super-cozy living room with original refinished hardwood floors & small coat closet. Keep walking to. . .
Kitchen/Patio: . . .w/Mexican ceramic tile floor set against original (now non-functioning) small fireplace. Handcrafted original wood kitchen cabinets remain from a rustic 1970s renovation. Clean white tile kitchen countertop & stainless steel sink with new dishwasher. Gas stove, refrigerator w/modular Ikea shelving. Your kitchen screen door allows summer breezes from the rear private patio to cool the house.
Basement: Your own washer & dryer + storage space!
Second floor: Original circular wood stairs lead up to 2nd floor hall w/original hardwood plank flooring. Full bathroom at the front of the house with ceramic tile, vanity & medicine cabinet. 2nd floor bedroom also has hardwood floor with sliding glass doors opening onto a south-facing exterior deck.
Third floor: Climb another set of circular steps to the top floor, where you'll find a second bedroom w/original hardwood floors and a super-high vaulted ceiling. There's another small room on the third floor, too -- great as a computer room, home office, extra large walk-in closet, etc.
Location: You're just a few blocks south of Washington Avenue, right off one of Queen Village's main North/South thoroughfares, East Moyamensing Avenue. Herman's Coffee and gourmet market is just a few steps from your front door! Don't miss the Vietnamese, Chinese, Korean & Mexican restaurants, supermarkets & stores on Washington Blvd, Front Street to Broad Street. Right around the corner is the Italian restaurant, Caffe Valentino. Even closer is our neighborhood beer garden, Pennsport Beer Boutique and their sister sandwich shop, Jaxx Steaks. Prefer fried chicken and homemade donuts? Federal Donuts is just a few blocks away. It's a 10-minute walk to the historic Italian Market & Pat's & Geno's Cheesesteaks. Also walk to South Street's shopping & restaurants. Pennsport is the home to Philadelphia's Mummers; "2" Street, just 2 blocks east, hosts street parties throughout the year.

description:
Available for March 1 (possibly sooner) is this super charming newly renovated 2 bedroom bi-level apartment with a private entrance at street level. Enter into a spacious living / dining room, beyond you will find a smaller kitchen but with a good amount of storage and counter space. All new appliances, including a gas range and dishwasher. 3174 Richmond Street, in the very heart of Port Richmond. This has a private entrance around the back on Emery Street. There are 2 other residential units in the building and a commercial space with entrances on Richmond Street. The commercial space is currently being built out to be a massage studio.
